Messages.Author: Florian Carl Friedrich Schulz
Messages.Content: Dear Students!  The final presentation will be on July 18th from 9:00 (s.t.) until 14:00 in MAR 4.033.  Please upload your final slides before. The final deadline for upload is July 16th at 23:59.  Contact us if you have any time conflicts or other problems that hinder you from participating! We can not guarantee but will try to find a solution. Given that you only have two weeks left, now is the time to dive deeply into your paper. Remember that you can always contact your paper advisor if you need help (please put us in CC so we can ensure everything works smoothly).  We are looking forward to your fantastic presentations and a fruitful discussion.  Damara and Florian

Messages.Author: Florian Carl Friedrich Schulz
Messages.Content: Dear Students, The papers have been distributed, and we hope many of you received your preferred choice. This link contains your paper along with your advisor's contact information. We recommend that you CC us when contacting your advisor so we can assist if communication stalls. For the presentations, we will either have a single extended session (~6 hours) on July 18th or 19th or two smaller sessions on both days. Details TBA. Please don't hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns.  We are looking forward to your presentations. Best regards, Damara & Florian (damara@tu-berlin.com & florian.cf.schulz@tu-berlin.de)

Messages.Author: Florian Carl Friedrich Schulz
Messages.Content: A little reminder to select your topic until the 30th of May - 10:00 AM.  Best Damara & Florian

Messages.Author: Florian Carl Friedrich Schulz
Messages.Content: Dear Students, Tomorrow will be the kickoff meeting for the Seminar "Generative Models" at Mar 4.033, from 10 to 10:30 AM. This is mandatory if you want to take the seminar. Looking forward to tomorrow's meeting! Best, Damara and Florian

Messages.Author: Benjamin Johannes Pfundstein
Messages.Content: Hello,  Can this course also be taken together with Cognitive Algorithms?

Messages.Author: Florian Carl Friedrich Schulz
Messages.Content: Hey Benjamin, Sorry for the super late reply! I am somewhat new to teaching and ISIS, and this message slipped through.  I'm not sure if your question is still relevant to you, but the answer is that it depends. We defined this seminar to be only eligible with Machine Learning I or II and Deep Learning I or II to ensure students have some understanding of machine learning. However, since I feel that students taking CA have quite diverse backgrounds and knowledge, you can take the seminar if you are fine with the somewhat enhanced difficulty of many of the discussed papers.  Don't hesitate to contact me if you have further questions. Next time, I'll answer way faster!  Best, Florian
